page.title: 20AN INTERVIEW WITH MRS WADLEY
page.content:
Mrs Wadley told us that before she was married she was in service.When she got married she lived in Braintree and moved to Easthorpe in 1932.Then for a few years she worked on the fields. Then she went on to do dinner parties for people doing the cooking and preparations.Then the war came along and her husband wasn't able to work because of injuries.Then she worked at Crittalls.After the war she was out of a job for a fortnight until she got a job at Marconi's in Chelmsford and she was there for twenty-four years until she retired.To Chelmsford from Easthorpe was fifteen miles.She used to cycle to Kelvedon and catch the bus from there.
This work was compiled by the twenty pupils in class J from Copford Primary School.
